MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 is: Use of the string handling functions from shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters. This rule strictly applies to the Standard Library functions in such as memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, and strspn. Provide your answer with these fields. - is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false), - scenario: a specific violation scenario. scenario: No violation: strlen(INDEX_PAGE_FOOTER) is safe provided INDEX_PAGE_FOOTER is a NUL-terminated string literal or array (as implied by its prior use with strlen/memcpy). Rule 21.17 would be violated only if INDEX_PAGE_FOOTER were NULL or pointed to a non-NUL-terminated buffer (in which case strlen could read past object bounds).
